page.title: 10SMUGGLING.
page.content: {Coastguard Cottages. The Coastguard Cottages near the sea remind us of the days when smuggling was common.From the sea the mill on Highdown and the spire of {East {Preston Church, }provided landmarks to guide in the boats which carried wine,brandy or wool. The {Coast Blockade}was set up in {1815}when a row of cottages were built.These cottages each share a single entrance door and hall.This may have been for economy or mutual defence,for the gangs were notoriously brutal.(19th records tell us that carriers earned 5/- a night, while the batmen (there protectors)earned 20/-. Farm labourers often earned money by joining the smugglers.Ingenious hiding places for the smuggled goods include the{Millers Tomb}on {HIGHDOWN}.
